eu.fbk.dkm.springles

Class Factory<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.dkm.springles.Factory<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of objects produced by the factory

    public abstract class Factory<T>
extends Object
    General-purpose factory based on RDF object specification.

    This class realizes a general-purpose factory functionality that permits to create objects specified through an RDF configuration and based on a registry of registered providers.

    The creation mechanism is articulated in two steps:

    1. A factory for a specific object is obtained through method get(Class, Graph, Resource), by specifying the (base) type of object to create and supplying an RDF graph containing an RDF specification of the properties of the object plus the configuration root node in the graph. A registry of providers is consulted in order to create the factory (see below). Errors in the RDF configuration are reported through RepositoryConfigExceptions
    2. The factory is used to instantiate one (or more) object(s) based on the RDF configuration supplied when creating the factory; errors preventing the creation of the object (not due to bad configurations) are reported through RepositoryExceptions.
    The two steps reflect the fact that object creation based on some configuration is performed by first parsing and checking the configuration, which is done during the first step of creating the factory, and then performing the actual instantiation, which occurs in the second step. Each step is correlated to its specific exceptions. If only configuration parsing and checking is required, the first step can be performed alone (just get the factory, do not invoke create).

    In order for objects of a certain class to be instantiable through this mechanism, it is necessary to register an implementation provider for that type of object. A provider is identified by a URI, the type of objects produced and a static method (on some class, does not matter which) that can be invoked in order to create a factory based on the RDF configuration at step 1. The exact signature of the provider method is the following:

    T name (Graph graph, Resource node)

    A provider is selected as part of the execution of get(Class, Graph, Resource), by matching the RDF type associated to the root nodes with the provider URIs; the factory-creation method of the chosen provider is then invoked to create the factory, by supplying exactly the same RDF graph and root node specified by the caller. Providers must be declared in classpath resources named META-INF/springles-factory. Each of these resources is a file consisting in a list of provider declarations separated by ;, each adhering to the format uri type method, where type is a full class name and method is a class_full_name.method_name name of the static factory-creation method. An example of declaration is the following:

    http://dkm.fbk.eu/springles#SpringlesStore eu.fbk.dkm.springles.store.SpringlesStore eu.fbk.dkm.springles.store.SpringlesStore.getFactory;

      • list

        public static List<org.openrdf.model.URI> list(Class<?> type)
        Lists all the provider URIs whose produced objects are compatible with the specified type.
        Parameters:
        type - the produced object (base) type
        Returns:
        a list of provider URIs

      • get

        public static <T> Factory<T> get(Class<T> type,
                 org.openrdf.model.Graph graph,
                 org.openrdf.model.Resource node)
                      throws org.openrdf.repository.config.RepositoryConfigException
        Creates a factory that produces objects whose type and properties are specified by the supplied RDF data. The method looks at the RDF types associated to the configuration root node and searches a provider whose URI matches one of those type URIs. This provider is then asked to instantiate a factory specific for the configuration data supplied. This process fails with a RepositoryConfigException in case a unique provider cannot be found or if the provider fails in creating the factory due to bad configuration data.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of objects produced by the factory
        Parameters:
        type - the base type of the object to produce
        graph - an RDF graph containing the configuration data
        node - the root configuration node in the RDF graph
        Returns:
        a factory able to produce objects corresponding to the supplied configuration data
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.config.RepositoryConfigException - in case there are no providers matching the configuration supplied or the configuration is not valid

      • get

        public static <T> Factory<Set<T>> get(Class<T> type,
                      org.openrdf.model.Graph graph,
                      Set<? extends org.openrdf.model.Resource> nodes)
                           throws org.openrdf.repository.config.RepositoryConfigException
        Helper method that creates a factory for a set of objects, each one with its own configuration. The method takes a RDF graph and a set of configuration nodes in that graph. The method creates a factory (using get(Class, Graph, Resource)) for each configuration node, and pack them in a new factory object able to create a set of objects by invoking in turns those factories.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of created object
        Parameters:
        type - the type of object to be produced and packed in the set
        graph - the RDF configuration graph
        nodes - a set of configuration nodes for the objects to produce, belonging to the same RDF graph
        Returns:
        a factory able to create a set of objects
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.config.RepositoryConfigException - in case any of the factories wrapped by the returned factory cannot be created due to bad configuration data or missing provider

      • get

        public static <T> Factory<List<T>> get(Class<T> type,
                       org.openrdf.model.Graph graph,
                       List<? extends org.openrdf.model.Resource> nodes)
                            throws org.openrdf.repository.config.RepositoryConfigException
        Helper method that creates a factory for a list of objects, each one with its own configuration. The method takes a RDF graph and a list of configuration nodes in that graph, with possible repetitions. The method creates a factory (using get(Class, Graph, Resource)) for each distinct configuration node, and pack them in a new factory object able to create a list of objects by invoking in turns those factories. Note that a unique object will be created for each configuration node, no matter how many times it appears in the supplied configuration node list (i.e., supplying twice the same node leads to creating a list that contains twice a uniquely created object).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of created object
        Parameters:
        type - the type of object to be produced and packed in the list
        graph - the RDF configuration graph
        nodes - a list of the configuration nodes for the objects to produce, belonging to the same RDF graph and with possible repetitions
        Returns:
        a factory able to create a list of objects
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.config.RepositoryConfigException - in case any of the factories wrapped by the returned factory cannot be created due to bad configuration data or missing provider

      • create

        public abstract T create()
                  throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Creates an object based on the configuration data encapsulated in this factory object. Once a factory is obtained, this method can be called multiple times to create objects whose type and properties match the configuration data supplied when creating the factory. The method may fail with a RepositoryException if an error occurs when creating the object, but it will not fail due to bad configuration data, as this is checked when creating the factory (see discussion on two step process in class overview).
        Returns:
        the created instance
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure
